english: modal particle indicating suggestion or urging

etymology.description: 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") as semantic indicator + 巴(巴) (bā, "cling") as phonetic component = speech or spoken suggestion -> modal particle "ba"
etymology.interpretation: The character 吧 incorporates 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") to emphasize its connection to speech, while 巴(巴) (bā, "cling") provides the pronunciation clue. It is used to express urging or suggestion in conversation.

examples.chinese: 不如试一试吧(不如試一試吧)，享受过程吧(享受過程吧)。
examples.pinyin: Bùrú shì yì shì ba, xiǎngshòu guòchéng ba.
examples.english: How about giving it a try, and enjoy the process.

examples.chinese: 明天早点出发吧(明天早点出發吧)。
